intro: Varronia jacmeliana, commonly known as the Jacmel tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It produces woody pods that contain small, round seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
